exams.title: React Fundamentals
exams.description: Whether you're a beginner or an experienced React developer, these multiple-choice questions will challenge your understanding of React concepts, best practices, and key features. Explore topics such as React components, state management, lifecycle methods, hooks, routing, and more. Put your skills to the test and see how well you fare in the world of React development.

questions.question: What is React?
Which of the following is NOT a core feature of React?
What does JSX stand for?
Which method is used to change the state of a React component?
What are React Hooks?
options: Reusable functions to manage component state and lifecycle
Built-in methods for data fetching in React

questions.question: Which lifecycle method is invoked immediately after a component is mounted?
What is the purpose of keys in React lists?
options: To uniquely identify elements in an array
To handle click events on list items

questions.question: Which of the following is used for routing in React?
What is the purpose of propTypes in React?
options: To specify the types of component props
To define the initial state of a component
To set default props for a component

questions.question: Which method is used to render a React component?
What is the purpose of shouldComponentUpdate()?
options: To define the component's HTML markup
To determine if a component should re-render

questions.question: What is the recommended way to update the state that depends on the previous state?
options: Triggering a re-render of the component

questions.question: What is a controlled component in React?
options: A component that is managed by Redux
A component with a two-way binding
A component that renders other components
A component that manages its own state

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid way to conditionally render content in React?
What is React context used for?
What is the purpose of the useEffect() hook in React?
options: To perform asynchronous operations in a component
To handle user input in a form
To perform side effects in a component

questions.question: Which of the following is used to create reusable React components?
What is the purpose of React.Fragment?
options: To create a new React project
To define the root element of a React component
To handle form submissions in React

questions.question: What is the purpose of the prop drilling problem in React?
options: To optimize the performance of React components
To share state between sibling components
To handle component composition in React
To pass data through multiple layers of components

questions.question: What is the recommended way to fetch data in React?
What is the purpose of the React DevTools extension?
options: To optimize the performance of React applications
To generate code snippets for React components
To automate the deployment of React applications

questions.question: Which method is used to remove a component from the DOM in React?
What is the purpose of the key prop in React lists?
options: To uniquely identify elements in an array
To specify the order of list items
To handle click events on list items

questions.question: What is the purpose of the shouldComponentUpdate() method in React?
options: To define the component's HTML markup
To determine if a component should re-render

questions.question: What is the purpose of the React Router library?
options: To handle form submissions in React
To perform routing in a React application

questions.question: Which method is used to update the state in React?
What is the purpose of the PureComponent class in React?
options: To define a component with a pure function
To optimize the performance of React applications
To handle component composition in React
To perform server-side rendering in React
